studyDesigns.name: Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: Protocol-defined study design for investigating efficacy and safety

arms.name: ALXN1840 Repeat-Dose Treatment (15 mg/day with titration to 30 mg/day)
arms.description: Single-arm, open-label repeat-dose study in participants with Wilson disease. Participants initiate ALXN1840 15 mg/day on Day 1 for approximately 28 days, followed by titration to 30 mg/day on Day 29 after Safety Review Committee review of available safety data through Day 23. Adaptive feature allows remaining on 15 mg/day for the duration if safety concerns; dose range allowed 15 mg every other day to 30 mg/day.

studyCohorts.name: Cohort 1 (Treatment experienced)
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients who have received Wilson disease therapy for > 28 days (includes standard of care therapies or ALXN1840).

studyCohorts.name: Cohort 2 (Treatment naïve)
studyCohorts.characteristic: Patients who have received Wilson disease therapy for ≤ 28 days.

eligibilityCriteria.name: Ability to comply with study procedures
Discontinue chelator therapy prior to initiation
Avoid minerals containing copper, zinc, or molybdenum
Decompensated cirrhosis or MELD score exclusion
Significant disorders or psychiatric disorder exclusion
Positive urine drug toxicology screen exclusion
Unwilling to complete meals/tolerate controlled menu exclusion

population.name: Study Population
population.description: Target population defined by eligibility criteria

objectives.name: Primary
objectives.text: Assess net copper balance with daily repeat-dose ALXN1840 treatment (15 mg and 30 mg) in participants with Wilson disease (WD)

objectives.name: Secondary
objectives.text: Assess change in copper balance in response to ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day during ALXN1840 accumulation and at steady state periods versus the pretreatment baseline in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary
objectives.text: Investigate the effect of ALXN1840 (15 mg/day and 30 mg/day) on the disposition of copper in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary
objectives.text: Investigate the effect of ALXN1840 on the disposition of molybdenum at steady state at 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary
objectives.text: Assess steady-state total molybdenum balance as a measure of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary
objectives.text: Assess accumulation of molybdenum with ALXN1840 treatment at 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Secondary
objectives.text: Determine the steady-state plasma pharmacokinetic (PK) of total molybdenum and plasma ultrafiltrate (PUF) molybdenum (as surrogate measures of ALXN1840, 15 mg and 30 mg) in participants with WD

objectives.name: Safety
objectives.text: Evaluate the safety and tolerability of repeated-dose administration of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory
objectives.text: Determine dose response of ALXN1840 15 mg/day and 30 mg/day for copper balance in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory
objectives.text: Determine the effect of treatment duration on copper balance in participants with WD

objectives.name: Exploratory
objectives.text: Assess the effects of ALXN1840 on ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper LBC profiles in plasma in participants with WD

endpoints.name: Mean daily copper balance
endpoints.text: Mean daily copper balance where copper balance is measured by the calculated difference between copper intake (in food and drink) and copper output (in feces and urine) during ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Change in mean daily copper balance
endpoints.text: Change in mean daily copper balance as measured by the calculated difference between copper intake (in food and drink) and copper output (in feces and urine) from pretreatment baseline (Days -4 through -1) and ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Copper disposition measures
endpoints.text: Copper quantified in food, drink, feces, and urine, including plasma total and labile bound copper (LBC) during ALXN1840 accumulation and steady-state periods for each dose

endpoints.name: Molybdenum disposition measures
endpoints.text: Molybdenum quantified in food, drink, feces, and urine, plasma total molybdenum at ALXN1840 steady state

endpoints.name: Mean daily molybdenum balance
endpoints.text: Mean daily molybdenum balance as demonstrated through measurement of molybdenum intake (in food, drink and ALXN1840), and molybdenum output (feces and urine) representing ALXN1840 steady state

endpoints.name: Accumulation of molybdenum
endpoints.text: Accumulation of molybdenum as determined by molybdenum balance

endpoints.name: PK parameters for plasma total and PUF-molybdenum
endpoints.text: PK parameters for plasma total and PUF-molybdenum

endpoints.name: Safety parameters
endpoints.text: Safety parameters: • Treatment emergent adverse events (TEAEs)/serious adverse events (SAEs) • Clinical laboratory assessments (serum chemistry, hematology, coagulation, and urinalysis) • Physical examinations • Heart rate, intervals (PR, QRS, QT and QTc), and clinically significant electrocardiogram (ECG) findings as determined by triplicate 12-lead ECG • Vital sign assessments (blood pressure and heart rate)

endpoints.name: Assess dose response of ALXN1840 on copper balance focusing on copper balance
endpoints.text: Assess dose response of ALXN1840 on copper balance focusing on copper balance

endpoints.name: Effect of time following initiation on copper balance
endpoints.text: Determine the effect of time following initiation of ALXN1840 treatment on copper balance

endpoints.name: Ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper, and LBC
endpoints.text: Ceruloplasmin, ceruloplasmin-bound copper, and LBC: Change in ceruloplasmin at Days 1, 8, 25, 29, 36, and Day 39 compared with predose

exits.name: Study completion definition
exits.description: Participant completes all phases including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities (SoA).

exits.name: Early discontinuation visit on study withdrawal
exits.description: At time of discontinuation from the study, if possible, an early discontinuation visit should be conducted as shown in the SoA.

exits.name: Definitive study intervention discontinuation but remain in study for safety follow-up
exits.description: If study intervention is definitively discontinued, participant should remain in the study to be evaluated for safety follow-up (per SoA).

exits.name: Sponsor termination/closure of site or study
exits.description: Alexion may close a site or terminate the study at any time for any reason; early site closure reasons include noncompliance, inadequate recruitment, or discontinuation of development.

notes.text: a Within 42 days of ALXN1840 administration. Details of procedures that may be performed by sites designated as “screening sites” (only in the US) are detailed in Section 8.
b Participants will be admitted to the clinical research unit (CRU) at least 10 hours prior to enrollment and initiation of copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet.
c At the CRU’s discretion, participants may remain in the CRU or be readmitted on Day 22 with all procedures starting on Day 23.
d Unscheduled study visits may occur any time during the study and may include any study procedure as deemed necessary by the Investigator.
e Participants are required to return to the CRU Day 54+/-2; participants will be discontinued from ALXN1840 medication by their physician at the latest by the Day 54 follow-up.

f Discharge from the unit may occur after completion of all procedures on Day 9 and on Day 40 and after the Investigator has reviewed all safety assessment (including safety laboratory tests) and confirmed that the participant is appropriate for discharge.

g A single outpatient visit or phone call and safety laboratory assessment should occur between Day 14 and Day 18. A phone call may take place on a different day than the blood draw within the Day 14 through Day 18 period.
h If needed to confirm menopause.
i Parameters include age and sex. Race and ethnicity will be collected where permitted by local regulations.
j Wilson disease history will include diagnosis date, method of diagnosis, history of cirrhosis, details of any previous liver biopsies performed, and treatment received.

k A full physical examination will be performed at Screening, at check-in for the study, and at the End of the study/Early Termination Visit. A physical examination should also be performed on any participants with ongoing adverse events prior to discharge from the unit. Otherwise, a symptom-driven physical examination may be performed at other times, at the Principal Investigator’s discretion.
l Height at screening only.

m While in the CRU, study intervention will be administered after an overnight fast (ie, at least 10 hours) at the same time every morning; drug is to be administered with 240 mL of water and meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing. As an outpatient, participants are expected to take ALXN1840 at approximately the same time daily (+/-1 hour). Participants should take the medication with a glass of water on an empty stomach; meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing.
n During the outpatient period, participants will use SMS text messaging to confirm study intervention administration.
o Blood sampling for PK/PD will occur before ALXN1840 administration and represents a predose trough. See Table 2 for PK/PD sampling on Days 1, 25, 29, and 39.
p PK/PD collection will include timepoints described in the schedule of PK/PD assessment for Days 1, 25, 29, and 39 (Table 2).

q Samples for serum chemistry will be obtained following a fast of at least 8 hours at the Screening Visit and at check-in. In case of rechecks, and postdose serum chemistry, participants may not have fasted for 6 or 8 hours before the serum chemistry sample is taken.
r Laboratory assessment including chemistry, hematology, and coagulation parameters should be performed on Days -8, -1, 8, 23, and 28 only.
s Menstruation check is for women only; women of childbearing potential should only be enrolled after a negative serum pregnancy test result at Screening.

t Additional urine pregnancy testing will be standard for the protocol unless serum testing is required by site policies, local regulation, or Institutional Review Boards (IRBs)/Independent Ethics Committees (IECs) (Section 10.2). In addition to pregnancy tests detailed at the visits in the SoA, females of childbearing potential will be required to perform urine pregnancy tests at least every 4 weeks at their home or the study site throughout their time in the study.
u A single 15 mL serum sample will be retained for evaluation in the event of an unexpected safety finding; retained samples may be destroyed after completion of the clinical study report.

v Vital signs measurements and ECGs should be performed predose, unless otherwise specified. Vitals signs include body temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, and systolic and diastolic blood pressure.

w Copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet will be initiated after registration/inclusion. Participants will remain on a copper/molybdenum controlled diet throughout the inpatient Period 1 (Day -8 to Day 9) and inpatient Period 2 (Day 23 to Day 40); during this time participants will be strongly encouraged to complete all meals. While not in the CRU, participants will be encouraged to adhere to their usual copper-controlled diet.
x For each input/output balance period, 24-hour urine samples are to be collected for measurement of copper and molybdenum.
y For fecal samples, each individual sample will be independently collected with record of date, time, and weight of the sample.
h If needed to confirm menopause.
i Parameters include age and sex. Race and ethnicity will be collected where permitted by local regulations.
j Wilson disease history will include diagnosis date, method of diagnosis, history of cirrhosis, details of any previous liver biopsies performed, and treatment received.
p PK/PD collection will include timepoints described in the schedule of PK/PD assessment for Days 1, 25, 29, and 39 (Table 2).

w Copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet will be initiated after registration/inclusion. Participants will remain on a copper/molybdenum controlled diet throughout the inpatient Period 1 (Day -8 to Day 9) and inpatient Period 2 (Day 23 to Day 40); during this time participants will be strongly encouraged to complete all meals. While not in the CRU, participants will be encouraged to adhere to their usual copper-controlled diet.

procedures.description: Individually collect fecal samples; record date/time/weight; store and analyze for copper and molybdenum concentration/content

procedures.name: Inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry

code.decode: Molecular pathology procedure (used as placeholder; ICP-MS not uniquely coded in standard CPT/HCPCS in this excerpt)

procedures.label: ICP-MS Elemental Analysis
procedures.description: Laboratory quantification of copper and molybdenum concentrations in food, fluids, urine, feces, and plasma samples

procedures.name: Bowel and urine output monitoring

code.decode: Remote physiologic monitoring treatment management services (representative for monitoring activity)

procedures.label: Urination/Bowel Movement Monitoring
procedures.description: Monitor and record urination and bowel movements; include menstruation checks where applicable

procedures.name: Intake monitoring

code.decode: Medical nutrition therapy; re-assessment and intervention (representative)

procedures.label: Food/Fluid Intake Monitoring
procedures.description: Monitor and document intake for copper/molybdenum balance calculations (food, drink, investigational agent)

analysisPopulations.name: Screened Set
analysisPopulations.text: The Screened Set includes all subjects who signed an informed consent form.
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The Screened Set includes all subjects who signed an informed consent form.

analysisPopulations.name: Enrolled Set
analysisPopulations.text: The Enrolled Set includes all subjects who are enrolled into the study.
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The Enrolled Set includes all subjects who are enrolled into the study.

analysisPopulations.name: Full Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.text: The Full Analysis Set includes all enrolled subjects who received at least 1 dose of ALXN1840.
analysisPopulations.label: FA
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The Full Analysis Set includes all enrolled subjects who received at least 1 dose of ALXN1840.
analysisPopulations.criteria: Enrolled AND received ≥1 dose of ALXN1840

analysisPopulations.name: Per Protocol Set
analysisPopulations.text: The Per Protocol Set includes all subjects in the Full Analysis Set who did not have any major protocol deviations that could impact the primary endpoint.
analysisPopulations.label: PP
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The Per Protocol Set includes all subjects in the Full Analysis Set who did not have any major protocol deviations that could impact the primary endpoint.
analysisPopulations.criteria: In Full Analysis Set AND no major protocol deviations impacting the primary endpoint

analysisPopulations.name: Safety Set
analysisPopulations.text: The Safety Set includes all enrolled subjects who received at least 1 dose of ALXN1840.
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The Safety Set includes all enrolled subjects who received at least 1 dose of ALXN1840.
analysisPopulations.criteria: Enrolled AND received ≥1 dose of ALXN1840

analysisPopulations.name: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.text: The Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set includes all subjects in the Safety Set who have at least 1 post-dose pharmacokinetic assessment.
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set includes all subjects in the Safety Set who have at least 1 post-dose pharmacokinetic assessment.
analysisPopulations.criteria: In Safety Set AND has ≥1 post-dose PK assessment

analysisPopulations.name: Pharmacodynamic Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.text: The Pharmacodynamic Analysis Set includes all subjects in the Safety Set who have at least 1 post-dose pharmacodynamic assessment.
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The Pharmacodynamic Analysis Set includes all subjects in the Safety Set who have at least 1 post-dose pharmacodynamic assessment.
analysisPopulations.criteria: In Safety Set AND has ≥1 post-dose PD assessment

["a Within 42 days of ALXN1840 administration. Details of procedures that may be performed by sites designated as \u201cscreening sites\u201d (only in the US) are detailed in Section 8.", "b Participants will be admitted to the clinical research unit (CRU) at least 10 hours prior to enrollment and initiation of copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet.", "c At the CRU\u2019s discretion, participants may remain in the CRU or be readmitted on Day 22 with all procedures starting on Day 23.", "d Unscheduled study visits may occur any time during the study and may include any study procedure as deemed necessary by the Investigator.", "e Participants are required to return to the CRU Day 54+/-2; participants will be discontinued from ALXN1840 medication by their physician at the latest by the Day 54 follow-up.", "f Discharge from the unit may occur after completion of all procedures on Day 9 and on Day 40 and after the Investigator has reviewed all safety assessment (including safety laboratory tests) and confirmed that the participant is appropriate for discharge.", "g A single outpatient visit or phone call and safety laboratory assessment should occur between Day 14 and Day 18. A phone call may take place on a different day than the blood draw within the Day 14 through Day 18 period.", "h If needed to confirm menopause.", "i Parameters include age and sex. Race and ethnicity will be collected where permitted by local regulations.", "j Wilson disease history will include diagnosis date, method of diagnosis, history of cirrhosis, details of any previous liver biopsies performed, and treatment received.", "k A full physical examination will be performed at Screening, at check-in for the study, and at the End of the study/Early Termination Visit. A physical examination should also be performed on any participants with ongoing adverse events prior to discharge from the unit. Otherwise, a symptom-driven physical examination may be performed at other times, at the Principal Investigator\u2019s discretion.", "l Height at screening only.", "m While in the CRU, study intervention will be administered after an overnight fast (ie, at least 10 hours) at the same time every morning; drug is to be administered with 240 mL of water and meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing. As an outpatient, participants are expected to take ALXN1840 at approximately the same time daily (+/-1 hour). Participants should take the medication with a glass of water on an empty stomach; meals should be delayed a minimum of 2 hours after dosing.", "n During the outpatient period, participants will use SMS text messaging to confirm study intervention administration.", "o Blood sampling for PK/PD will occur before ALXN1840 administration and represents a predose trough. See Table 2 for PK/PD sampling on Days 1, 25, 29, and 39.", "p PK/PD collection will include timepoints described in the schedule of PK/PD assessment for Days 1, 25, 29, and 39 (Table 2).", "q Samples for serum chemistry will be obtained following a fast of at least 8 hours at the Screening Visit and at check-in. In case of rechecks, and postdose serum chemistry, participants may not have fasted for 6 or 8 hours before the serum chemistry sample is taken.", "r Laboratory assessment including chemistry, hematology, and coagulation parameters should be performed on Days -8, -1, 8, 23, and 28 only.", "s Menstruation check is for women only; women of childbearing potential should only be enrolled after a negative serum pregnancy test result at Screening.", "t Additional urine pregnancy testing will be standard for the protocol unless serum testing is required by site policies, local regulation, or Institutional Review Boards (IRBs)/Independent Ethics Committees (IECs) (Section 10.2). In addition to pregnancy tests detailed at the visits in the SoA, females of childbearing potential will be required to perform urine pregnancy tests at least every 4 weeks at their home or the study site throughout their time in the study.", "u A single 15 mL serum sample will be retained for evaluation in the event of an unexpected safety finding; retained samples may be destroyed after completion of the clinical study report.", "v Vital signs measurements and ECGs should be performed predose, unless otherwise specified. Vitals signs include body temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, and systolic and diastolic blood pressure.", "w Copper- and molybdenum-controlled diet will be initiated after registration/inclusion. Participants will remain on a copper/molybdenum controlled diet throughout the inpatient Period 1 (Day -8 to Day 9) and inpatient Period 2 (Day 23 to Day 40); during this time participants will be strongly encouraged to complete all meals. While not in the CRU, participants will be encouraged to adhere to their usual copper-controlled diet.", "x For each input/output balance period, 24-hour urine samples are to be collected for measurement of copper and molybdenum.", "y For fecal samples, each individual sample will be independently collected with record of date, time, and weight of the sample."]

titles.text: A Phase 2, Open-label Study to Assess Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840
Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840

organizations.name: European Parliament and the Council of the European Union
organizations.identifier: European Parliament and the Council of the European Union

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Age
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants aged ≥18 at the time of signing the ICF.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Diagnosis of Wilson disease
eligibilityCriterionItems.text:
Diagnosis of WD by Leipzig Criteria ≥ 4 documented by testing as outlined in the 2012 European Association for the Study of Liver WD Clinical Practice Guidelines  
(Ferenci, 2003; EASL, 2012) or by historical test results for WD including some or all of the following:
• Presence of Kayser Fleischer rings,
• Neurological symptoms,
• Serum ceruloplasmin below reference range,
• Coombs-negative hemolytic anemia,
• Elevated liver or urinary copper,
• Presence of mutations in the ATP7B gene, or
• Other, as considered appropriate, may be used instead to confirm the diagnosis of WD.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Investigator benefit assessment
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants who in the opinion of the referring Investigator may benefit from decoppering therapy.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Ability to comply with study procedures
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants must be able to comply with all study-related procedures.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Ability to reside in CRU
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants must be able to reside in the CRU for intensive metabolic monitoring of copper and molybdenum.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Discontinue chelator therapy prior to initiation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants willing to discontinue chelator therapy for approximately 4 days prior to initiation of ALXN1840 to allow a baseline assessment of copper balance.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Adequate venous access
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants with adequate venous access to allow collection of required blood samples.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Swallow intact tablets
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants must be able to swallow intact ALXN1840 tablets.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Avoid minerals containing copper, zinc, or molybdenum
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants willing to avoid use of minerals containing copper, zinc, or molybdenum throughout the study duration.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Diet adherence
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants willing to adhere to copper/molybdenum-controlled diet during inpatient periods and willing to comply with a low copper dietary requirement during the Outpatient Period.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Contraception requirements
eligibilityCriterionItems.text:
Contraceptive use by men or women should be consistent with local regulations regarding the methods of contraception for those participating in clinical studies.
a. Male participants:
• Male participants, if heterosexually active and with a female spouse or partner of childbearing potential or a pregnant or breastfeeding spouse or partner, must agree to use barrier contraception (male condom) for the duration of the study and for at least 3 months after the end of systemic exposure of the study intervention. Male participants must not donate sperm for at least 3 months after the end of systemic exposure of the study intervention.
• Female spouses or partners of male participants who are of childbearing potential must use highly effective contraception as defined below and in Section 10.4, starting at least 1 menstrual cycle before (the male participant’s) first study intervention administration and continuing until at least 3 months after the end of their male partner’s systemic exposure to the study intervention.
• Barrier contraception (male condom) is required even with documented medical assessment of surgical success of a vasectomy. For male participants who have had a vasectomy (with documented evidence of azoospermia if possible) and agree to use a male condom for the stated time period, no additional contraceptive method is required by their female partner.
b. Female participants:
• Female participants or female partners of male participants of childbearing potential (including breastfeeding females), if heterosexually active, must be willing to follow protocol-specified contraception guidance starting at least 1 menstrual cycle before first study intervention administration and continuing for at least 3 months after the end of systemic exposure of the study intervention. Female participants must not donate ova for at least 3 months after the end of systemic exposure of the study intervention.
• Female participants who are documented as being of non-childbearing potential as defined in Section 10.4 are exempt from contraception requirements.
• Highly effective contraceptive methods for female participants and female partners of male participants are described in Section 10.4.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Informed consent
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants capable of giving signed informed consent, which includes compliance with the requirements and restrictions listed in the ICF and in this protocol.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Decompensated cirrhosis or MELD score exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Decompensated cirrhosis or model for end-stage liver disease (MELD) score > 13.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Modified Nazer score exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Modified Nazer score > 7 (Dhawan, 2005).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Gastrointestinal bleed exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Clinically significant gastrointestinal bleed within past 3 months.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: ALT exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) > 2 × upper limit of normal (ULN).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Marked neurological disease exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Marked neurological disease requiring assistance with self-care or activities of daily life.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Hemoglobin exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Hemoglobin less than lower limit of the reference range for age and sex.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Viral infection exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Active infection with hepatitis B virus (positive hepatitis B surface antigen) or C virus (participants with positive hepatitis C antibody result would require confirmation of active disease with a positive hepatitis C polymerase chain reaction test), or seropositivity for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Significant disorders or psychiatric disorder exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History or presence of/significant history of or current cardiovascular, respiratory, hepatic, renal, gastrointestinal, endocrinological, hematological, or neurological disorders, or psychiatric disorder that in the opinion of the Investigator may constitute a risk when taking the study intervention; or may interfere with the interpretation of data.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Prior ALXN1840/tetrathiomolybdate exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Previous treatment with ALXN1840 or other form of tetrathiomolybdate within 1 year prior to dosing.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Prior zinc treatment exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Previous treatment with zinc within 21 days prior to Day 1.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Experimental therapy exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: The use of an experimental or unapproved/unlicensed therapy at the same time or within 90 days or 5 half-lives, whichever is longer, prior to the Screening Visit.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Renal failure exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants in renal failure, defined as in end-stage renal disease on dialysis (chronic kidney disease [CKD] stage 5) or creatinine clearance < 30 mL/min (Levey, 2006).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Pregnancy/breastfeeding exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Pregnant (or females who are planning to become pregnant) or breastfeeding females (women of childbearing potential must have a negative serum pregnancy test result at screening).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Sensitivity to ALXN1840 exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Known sensitivity to ALXN1840, ALXN1840 excipients (anhydrous dicalcium phosphate, anhydrous sodium carbonate), or any of the ingredients contained in ALXN1840 or related compounds.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Non-compliance/uncooperative exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: In the opinion of the Investigator, the participant and/or their legal guardian is likely to be non-compliant or uncooperative during the study.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Illicit drug/alcohol abuse history exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: History of illicit drug abuse, history of significant alcohol abuse within 1 year prior to the Screening Visit, or clinical evidence of substance and/or alcohol abuse within the 2 years before screening. Alcohol abuse is defined as regular weekly intake of more than 14 units (for both males and females), using the following National Health Service (NHS) alcohol tracker http://www.nhs.uk/Tools/Pages/drinks-tracker.aspx.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Positive urine drug toxicology screen exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Positive urine drug toxicology screen at Screening or on Day -8 (cannabinoids will not be tested).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Alcohol consumption/breath test exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Alcohol consumption within 48 hours prior to study intervention administration or positive alcohol breath test at screening or on Day -8.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Unwilling to complete meals/tolerate controlled menu exclusion
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participants unwilling to consistently complete every meal and tolerate a controlled, limited menu for the duration of the study.

studyInterventions.name: ALXN1840
studyInterventions.description: Oral bis-choline tetrathiomolybdate (formerly WTX101), a copper binding agent for Wilson disease; administered as repeat-dose 15 mg/day with planned titration to 30 mg/day.

studyInterventions.name: Penicillamine
studyInterventions.description: Wilson disease copper-chelating therapy; participants taking it at enrollment must discontinue starting Day -4 to allow baseline copper/molybdenum balance assessment.

studyInterventions.name: Trientine
studyInterventions.description: Wilson disease copper-chelating therapy; participants taking it at enrollment must discontinue starting Day -4 to allow baseline copper/molybdenum balance assessment.

studyInterventions.name: Zinc therapy
studyInterventions.description: Wilson disease therapy affecting intestinal copper absorption; must be discontinued and participants must be off zinc for a minimum of 21 days prior to Day 1.

studyInterventions.name: Acetaminophen (paracetamol)
studyInterventions.description: Permitted concomitant medication with Investigator approval; maximum 1000 mg/day.

studyInterventions.name: Ibuprofen
studyInterventions.description: Permitted concomitant medication with Investigator approval; use with caution; maximum 1200 mg in any 24-hour period.

amendments.name: Amendment 1

code.decode: Protocol Amendment

amendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to update procedures outlined in the Schedule of Activities, remove contradictory text on the reporting of serious adverse events, and add details of an interim analysis. Additional, minor changes are included in the table below.

amendments.name: Amendment 2

code.decode: Protocol Amendment

amendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to revise the exclusion criterion for a urine drug screen. Changes implemented via Administrative Letter 1 and Administrative Letter 2, as well as COVID vaccination guidance, have also been incorporated.

amendments.name: Amendment 3

code.decode: Protocol Amendment

amendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to update the washout period for zinc. Additional changes are listed below.

amendments.name: Amendment 3.1 (US)

code.decode: Protocol Amendment

amendments.summary: The main reason for preparation of this amendment was to clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US, so as to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US, and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising the quality of the study.

medicalDevices.name: 12-lead electrocardiograph
medicalDevices.label: 12-lead ECG device
medicalDevices.description: Device used to acquire triplicate 12-lead ECGs including specified postdose timepoints

medicalDevices.name: Automated blood pressure monitor
medicalDevices.label: Automated BP device
medicalDevices.description: Completely automated device used for blood pressure and heart rate measurements; manual technique only if automated device unavailable

medicalDevices.name: Inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometer
medicalDevices.label: ICP-MS
medicalDevices.description: Analytical instrument used to determine copper and molybdenum concentrations in collected samples

medicalDevices.name: Peripheral intravenous cannula/catheter
medicalDevices.label: IV cannula
medicalDevices.description: Cannula/catheter placed for repeated blood draws; not left in place longer than 72 hours; flushed at least every 8 hours

medicalDevices.name: Water bottle dispenser

conditions.name: Titration safety review requirement
conditions.description: SRC reviews available safety data through Day 23 before titration to 30 mg/day
conditions.text: Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

conditions.name: Outpatient Period extension requires Investigator approval
conditions.description: Outpatient Period during Treatment Period 1 may be extended up to 14 additional days with Investigator approval
conditions.text: To ensure flexibility, the Outpatient Period during Treatment Period 1 may be extended up to an additional 14 days with Investigator approval.

conditions.name: Remain on 15 mg/day if safety concerns
conditions.description: Participants may remain on 15 mg/day for duration of study if safety concerns in opinion of Investigator(s) and/or Alexion
conditions.text: Increase to 30 mg after 4 weeks, unless there are safety concerns that, in the opinion of the Investigator(s) and/or Alexion, may place participants at undue risk, in which case, participants may remain on the 15 mg/day dose for the duration of the study.

conditions.name: Eligibility: zinc washout
conditions.description: Must be off zinc therapy for minimum 21 days prior to Day 1
conditions.text: Participants must be off zinc therapy for a minimum of 21 days prior to Day 1.

conditions.name: Eligibility: prior ALXN1840/tetrathiomolybdate exposure
conditions.description: Exclusion if prior ALXN1840 or tetrathiomolybdate within 1 year prior to dosing
conditions.text: Previous treatment with ALXN1840 or other form of tetrathiomolybdate within 1 year prior to dosing.

conditions.name: Eligibility: experimental therapy timing
conditions.description: Exclusion for experimental/unapproved therapy within 90 days or 5 half-lives (whichever longer) prior to Screening
conditions.text: The use of an experimental or unapproved/unlicensed therapy at the same time or within 90 days or 5 half-lives, whichever is longer, prior to the Screening Visit.

conditions.name: Disallowed concomitant medications timing
conditions.description: Must abstain from prescription meds within 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever longer) of Day -7; nonprescription within 7 days or 5 half-lives (whichever longer) before Day -7 until follow-up completion
conditions.text: Participants must abstain from taking prescription medications within 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever is longer) of Day -7 or nonprescription drugs... within 7 days or 5 half-lives... before Day -7 and until completion of the follow-up visit.

conditions.name: Dose modification trigger: bilirubin and ALT
conditions.description: Bilirubin >2x ULN accompanied by ALT >3x ULN indicative of liver injury triggers temporary interruption; weekly repeat testing; rechallenge only with approval and when bilirubin below ULN at 15 mg QOD or less frequent
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN... Temporary interruption; Weekly repeat testing; Rechallenge at 15 mg QOD or less frequent when bilirubin is below ULN; requires approval of the Alexion Medical Monitor.

conditions.name: Dose modification trigger: neurologic worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or neurologic exam prompts evaluation with Medical Monitor for dose modification; must document and follow until completion/resolution
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening... Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification... All neurologic worsening should be documented as AEs and followed up until study completion or resolution.

conditions.name: Dose modification trigger: psychiatric worsening
conditions.description: Clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening (including suicidality, acute depression, psychosis) prompts evaluation for dose modification; document as AE and follow until completion/resolution
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening... Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification... followed until completion of the study or resolution.

conditions.name: Rechallenge limit after dose modification
conditions.text: A maximum of 3 rechallenges will be allowed.

conditions.name: Discontinue study intervention considerations for ECG changes
conditions.description: Clinically significant finding including QTcF changes after enrollment requires determination if participant can continue
conditions.text: If a clinically significant finding is identified (including... QTcF) after enrollment, the Investigator... will determine if the participant can continue in the study...

conditions.name: Discontinue study intervention if serious hypersensitivity reaction
conditions.description: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention
conditions.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if... Serious hypersensitivity reaction.

conditions.name: Discontinue study intervention if severe uncontrolled infection
conditions.description: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention
conditions.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if... Severe uncontrolled infection.

conditions.name: Discontinue study intervention if use of disallowed medication
conditions.description: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention
conditions.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if... Use of disallowed medication.

conditions.name: Discontinue study intervention if pregnancy or planned pregnancy
conditions.description: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention
conditions.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if... Pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

conditions.name: Discontinue study intervention at Alexion/Investigator discretion
conditions.description: Participants must be considered for discontinuation if Alexion or Investigator deems necessary
conditions.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if... Alexion or the Investigator deems it is necessary for the participant.

conditions.name: Lost to follow-up determination process
conditions.description: Before deeming lost to follow-up, make every effort including 3 telephone calls and if necessary a certified letter; if unreachable then considered withdrawn
conditions.text: Before a participant is deemed lost to follow-up... (where possible, 3 telephone calls and, if necessary, a certified letter)... Should the participant continue to be unreachable, he/she will be considered to have withdrawn from the study.

conditions.name: Adaptive design allowance
conditions.description: Adaptive features may be implemented at Investigator discretion; no protocol amendment required; limits described elsewhere (Table 4 not provided here)
conditions.text: This study incorporates the use of an adaptive design. Adaptive features may be implemented at the discretion of the Investigator... do not require amendment of the protocol.

study.name: A Phase 2, Open-label Study to Assess Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840

administrations.name: ALXN1840 15 mg/day (Treatment Period 1)
administrations.duration: Day 1 through Day 28 (approximately 28 days; minimum 4 weeks planned)

administrations.name: ALXN1840 repeat dosing overall
administrations.duration: Up to 40 days total dosing per Table 6; participants discontinued from ALXN1840 by their physician at the latest by Day 54 follow-up

administrations.name: ALXN1840 administration conditions (inpatient/CRU)
administrations.duration: While in CRU during dosing periods (inpatient periods)

administrations.name: ALXN1840 administration conditions (outpatient)
administrations.doseFrequency: once daily at approximately the same time (±1 hour)
administrations.duration: During Outpatient Period (Day 9 to Day 23; may be extended up to additional 14 days with Investigator approval)

administrations.name: ALXN1840 dose reduction / rechallenge for ALT elevation
administrations.duration: When ALT returns to <2×ULN (if baseline normal) or <2× increase from baseline (if baseline above reference range) after temporary interruption

administrations.name: ALXN1840 dose reduction for ALT increase >2× baseline or >2×ULN
administrations.dose: Reduce to previous dose level or to 15 mg every other day if on 15 mg once daily
administrations.doseFrequency: every other day (if reduced to 15 mg QOD)
administrations.duration: Until resolution of abnormality; no further dose increase until resolution

administrations.name: ALXN1840 dose modification for anemia (hemoglobin <8 g/dL without bleeding)
administrations.dose: 15 mg every other day (QOD) after interruption
administrations.duration: After temporary interruption; rechallenge when hemoglobin and other hematology parameters return to baseline

administrations.name: ALXN1840 dose modification for hemoglobin decrease >30% from baseline
administrations.dose: Reduce to previous dose level or to 15 mg every other day if on 15 mg once daily
administrations.doseFrequency: every other day (if reduced to 15 mg QOD)
administrations.duration: Until resolution of abnormality; no further dose increase until resolution

administrations.name: ALXN1840 dose modification for thrombocytopenia (platelets <30,000/µL)
administrations.dose: 15 mg every other day (QOD) after interruption
administrations.duration: After temporary interruption; rechallenge when platelets and other hematology parameters return to baseline

administrations.name: ALXN1840 dose modification for platelets decrease >30% from baseline (baseline low)
administrations.dose: Reduce to previous dose level or to 15 mg every other day if on 15 mg once daily
administrations.doseFrequency: every other day (if reduced to 15 mg QOD)
administrations.duration: Until resolution of abnormality; no further dose increase until resolution

administrations.name: ALXN1840 dose modification for neutropenia (neutrophils <1.0 × 10^3/µL)
administrations.dose: 15 mg every other day (QOD) after interruption
administrations.duration: After temporary interruption; rechallenge when neutrophils and other hematology parameters return to baseline

administrations.name: Penicillamine discontinuation for baseline assessment
administrations.duration: If taking at enrollment, discontinue starting Day -4 (approximately 4 days prior to initiating ALXN1840 on Day 1)

administrations.name: Trientine discontinuation for baseline assessment
administrations.duration: If taking at enrollment, discontinue starting Day -4 (approximately 4 days prior to initiating ALXN1840 on Day 1)

administrations.name: Zinc therapy washout
administrations.duration: Must be off zinc therapy for a minimum of 21 days prior to Day 1

administrations.name: Acetaminophen (paracetamol) permitted use
administrations.duration: As needed during study with Investigator approval

administrations.name: Ibuprofen permitted use
administrations.duration: As needed during study with Investigator approval

substances.name: bis-choline tetrathiomolybdate
substances.description: Active substance / drug name for ALXN1840; formerly known as WTX101.

substances.name: tetrathiomolybdate (active anion)
substances.description: Active anion contained in ALXN1840; rapidly binds copper to form tetrathiomolybdate-copper-albumin complex (TPC).

substances.name: tetrathiomolybdic acid
substances.description: Amount specified per tablet: 7.8 mg tetrathiomolybdic acid per 15 mg ALXN1840 tablet.

substances.name: penicillamine
substances.description: Copper-chelating therapy referenced as prior/concomitant WD therapy; discontinued for baseline assessments if used at enrollment.

substances.name: trientine
substances.description: Copper-chelating therapy referenced as prior/concomitant WD therapy; discontinued for baseline assessments if used at enrollment.

substances.name: zinc
substances.description: WD therapy; must be discontinued with minimum 21-day washout before Day 1.

substances.name: acetaminophen
substances.description: Allowed concomitant medication with maximum 1000 mg/day.

substances.name: ibuprofen
substances.description: Allowed concomitant medication with maximum 1200 mg per 24 hours; caution advised due to CYP2C9 substrate considerations.

studyDefinitionDocument.name: A Phase 2, Open-label Study to Assess Copper and Molybdenum Balance in Participants with Wilson Disease Treated with ALXN1840

transitionRules.name: Run-in to Treatment initiation
transitionRules.text: Following screening and enrollment, participants will have a Run-in Period... Following the Run-in Period, participants will be administered ALXN1840 (Day 1).

transitionRules.name: Dose titration 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day on Day 29 contingent on safety review
transitionRules.text: Participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day on Day 1 through Day 28 and then increase to 30 mg/day on Day 29... Before titration... SRC will review safety data through Day 23.

transitionRules.name: Remain on 15 mg/day for duration if safety concerns
transitionRules.text: Increase to 30 mg after 4 weeks, unless there are safety concerns... in which case, participants may remain on the 15 mg/day dose for the duration of the study.

transitionRules.name: Temporary interruption for suspected liver injury pattern
transitionRules.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN... Temporary interruption; weekly repeat testing; rechallenge only when bilirubin below ULN at 15 mg QOD or less frequent with Medical Monitor approval.

transitionRules.name: Dose modification evaluation for neurologic worsening
transitionRules.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening... Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification (interruption, increase or decrease)... re-evaluated at the next study visit.

transitionRules.name: Dose modification evaluation for psychiatric worsening
transitionRules.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening... Investigator and Alexion Medical Monitor will evaluate the need for dose modification... re-evaluated at the next study visit.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation of study intervention for safety/administrative triggers
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if any of the following occur: serious hypersensitivity reaction; severe uncontrolled infection; use of disallowed medication; pregnancy or planned pregnancy; or Alexion or the Investigator deems it is necessary.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation of study intervention for abnormal liver function (per dose modification criteria or best interest)
transitionRules.text: Discontinuation of study intervention for abnormal liver function should be considered when a participant meets one of the conditions outlined in the Dose Modification criteria... or if the Investigator believes it is in best interest of the participant.

transitionRules.name: Participant withdrawal/discontinuation from study
transitionRules.text: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time... or may be withdrawn... for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons; early discontinuation visit should be conducted if possible.

transitionRules.name: Lost to follow-up to withdrawn status
transitionRules.text: Before deemed lost to follow-up, make every effort (3 telephone calls and if necessary certified letter). If unreachable, participant will be considered to have withdrawn from the study.

transitionRules.name: Post-study therapy transition after completion of inpatient periods (Day 40)
transitionRules.text: Following completion of both inpatient periods (ie, Day 40), participants will transition to discontinued therapy, other standard of care, or may request continuation of ALXN1840 under preapproval access per local regulations.

commentAnnotations.text: Table 3 abbreviations: ALT = alanine aminotransferase; AST = aspartate aminotransferase; IB = Investigator’s Brochure; PK = pharmacokinetics; WD = Wilson disease.
Catheter/cannula comment: a catheter may not be left in place for longer than 72 hours and should be flushed a minimum of every 8 hours.
Lifestyle restrictions table abbreviations: CRF = case report form; CRU = clinical research unit; EOS = End of Study; SoA = Schedule of Activities.
Vital signs: if abnormal per inclusion/exclusion criteria, 2 additional measurements will be made and the average of 3 recorded in the CRF and used for eligibility.
Pharmacokinetics sampling window: samples collected within ±10% or 30 min (whichever is less) of scheduled time will not be considered a protocol deviation.
Retained/biobanked sample: single predose serum sample retained on site and discarded after clinical study report; not used for genetic testing.
Excess/additional whole blood samples may be stored for up to 5 years and used for PD/biomarker research; not for genetic analyses (RNA/DNA).
Population table abbreviations: ICF = informed consent form; PD = pharmacodynamic; PK = pharmacokinetic.

PK parameter note: Day 28 concentration-time profiles after last 15 mg dose will be extrapolated to Day 29 (0-24 hr) and subtracted from observed Day 29 profiles after first 30 mg dose (adjustment for accumulation calculations).

studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Added US-only clarification in SoA footnote indicating that certain procedures are specific to screening-only sites as detailed in Section 8

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 4.2 - Scientific Rationale for Study Design
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Updated scientific rationale text to align zinc discontinuation timing from 30 days to 21 days
Added US-only operational option for certain US sites to perform screening procedures only (no remaining study procedures), to support recruitment and reduce participant burden

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Clarify study procedures occurring across different sites in the US to facilitate participant recruitment across different regions of the US and to lessen inconvenience for participants without compromising study quality.
Align the number of days after zinc discontinuation referenced in Section 4.2 with the mention of zinc discontinuation elsewhere in the protocol.
Add US-only language allowing screening-only sites to support recruitment across different US regions and reduce participant inconvenience without compromising study quality.

studyChanges.afterText: Addition of text to the footnote to state that procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) [are] detailed in Section 8.
studyChanges.summary: Added SoA footnote text cross-referencing Section 8 for US screening-site-specific procedures.

studyChanges.beforeText: However, the physiologic turnover of human gastrointestinal epithelial cells is 3 - 5 days (Darwich, 2014); therefore, the inhibitory effect of zinc on intestinal copper absorption is expected to be minimal 30 days after discontinuation of zinc.
studyChanges.afterText: However, the physiologic turnover of human gastrointestinal epithelial cells is 3 - 5 days (Darwich, 2014); therefore, the inhibitory effect of zinc on intestinal copper absorption is expected to be minimal 21 days after discontinuation of zinc.
studyChanges.summary: Changed zinc washout timing statement from 30 days to 21 days.

studyChanges.afterText: Addition of text applicable only to the US that details the possibility for sites in the US to only perform screening procedures and not any of the remaining study procedures.
studyChanges.summary: Added US-only operational procedure allowing certain sites to conduct screening-only activities.
